title: Broadleaf Trees
name: broadleaf trees
rationale: LightGBM provided the best quantitative performance.
description: The birch trees diagnostic species set consists of all broadleaf deciduous trees in Alaska and Yukon (see species list below). By limiting inclusion to broadleaf trees, this set excludes Larix laricina (Du Roi) K. Koch, which is a needleleaf deciduous tree. Broadleaf trees are common throughout the boreal and temperate bioclimatic zones, but also occur in small, sporadic clusters in the several places in the Arctic (Populus balsamifera L.; Breen 2014). The map domain does not currently extend into Southeast Alaska (as of version 2.x) where Alnus rubra Bong. would be added to the species list.
species: Populus trichocarpa Torr. & A. Gray ex Hook.
